DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate safety efficacy prostatic artery embolization ( PAE ) patient refuse eligible surgery moderate-severe low urinary tract symptom indwell catheter secondary benign prostate obstruction due benign prostatic hyperplasia .
DOC.brief_title: Prostatic Artery Embolization Benign Prostatic Obstruction
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective study investigate safety efficacy PAE patient refuse eligible surgery suffers moderate-severe low urinary tract symptom indwell catheter secondary benign prostatic obstruction due benign prostatic hyperplasia . It may form ground research shape large randomise clinical trial . Our hypothesis PAE eliminate need indwell catheter improve IPSS 12 month post-procedure . 1 , 3 , 6 , 9 12 month follow-up . Main outcome Ability void removal indwell catheter Secondary outcomes DAN-PSS International Prostate Symptom Score ( IPSS ) Quality Life ( QoL ) International Index Erectile Function ( IIEF ) Prostate volume Peak void flow ( Qmax ) Post-void residual ( PVR ) Classify complication accord Society Interventional Radiology ( SIR ) guideline report Prostate-specific antigen ( PSA )
DOC.criteria: Indwelling catheter secondary benign prostatic hyperplasia ( BPH ) Moderatesevere Obstructive LUTS secondary BPH refractory medical treatment Unsuitable TURP refuse surgery Bladder dysfunction ( known neurological condition affect bladder function ) Urethral strictures Bladder neck contracture Known sphincter anomaly Big bladder diverticulum stone Kidney insufficiency ( eGFR < 45 ) Coagulation disturbance Severe atheromatous tortuosity artery Allergy contrast medium Unable undergo MR image Urological malignancy
